reviews.title: Breakfast gem
reviews.text:
Fresh, tasty, friendly, clean and cared for. 
Delicious breakfast and lunch here. Very fresh food, homemade soup is recommended. Served well. Friendly staff, politely welcoming and with a hi laugh.

reviews.title: Impeccable!
reviews.text: We enjoyed a delicious bouncer, rustic sandwich, and yogurt with granola. In addition, excellent coffee and fresh juice. Everything was perfectly cared for and tasteful.

reviews.title: Superb breakfasts and lovely owners
reviews.text: We recently stayed in Rotterdam and discovered Solo Espreso Bar near our hotel.  We went there every morning for breakfast, sitting both outside when it was hot, and inside when a bit cooler.  The place was spotless and the owners were helpful and charming.  We were quite boring and had the same breakfast each day but it was superb, and the owners kindly accommodated my husband's request for a slightly amended breakfast.  We would highly recommend.

articleContent.title: Your go-to guide for dog-friendly travel

seoInfo.metaDescription: Traveling with your dog has never been easier—or more fun. Cities across the country boast pet-friendly hotels, parks, and activities. With CESAR® brand’s mission to make the world more pet-friendly and Tripadvisor’s top-rated spots, you can plan with confidence. Whether it’s a quick getaway or a bucket-list trip, our guides help you stay, play, and explore with your pup. Grab the leash and go!

One thing to know about Dublin—this is a city that rewards detours. So when you get lost on cobblestone streets (and everyone does), resist the urge to map yourself back on course and poke around little cafes and shops first. Listen to the buskers along Grafton Street. Duck into any pub that looks appealing in Temple Bar.

articleContent.title: How to explore the Seven Hills of Rome

seoInfo.metaDescription: Conquer the seven hills of Rome on your next trip. Here's what to see and do for each.

articleContent.title: 15 stunning infinity pools in the world that are worth the trip

seoInfo.metaDescription: From the lush jungles of the Caribbean to the cityscapes of Singapore, here are 15 hotels with the best infinity pools from all across the globe.

articleContent.title: Why Greenville, SC is the perfect mix of adventure and luxury

seoInfo.metaDescription: There are few places that blend luxury and outdoor adventure like Greenville, South Carolina. The days (and mild weather) are made for adrenaline rushes of all types, while the region’s spas, fine dining, and boutique properties serve up luxury experiences that last well into the evening. It’s not hard to dive into a handful of the many treats on offer, and crafting an itinerary that incorporates a little bit of everything is how you’ll find yourself with a Greenville-shaped spot forever in your heart.

tripContent.title: Orlando: An LGBTQ+ family guide
tripContent.description: "Our family loves going to Orlando—and not just for the theme parks. Yes, we enjoy getting to ride rollercoasters and be transported to another world, but spending time in a colorful, diverse city and the surrounding nature is delightful. We live just over an hour from Orlando, so when we feel the need for good city vibes and to feel welcome in a neighborhood besides our own, Orlando is a fantastic option for us." - Rob Taylor, 2TravelDads.com

tripContent.title: Enter the unknown: Nevada’s wildest hidden realms
tripContent.description: Strange, surreal, and totally unforgettable, this is Nevada off the rails. From alien highways to haunted hotels, and from outdoor art playgrounds to eccentric ghost towns, this route is made for the curious traveler. Embrace the uncommon and uncover a different side of the Silver State, where ever stop feels like a secret waiting to be stumbled upon.

articleContent.title: 3 hot cruise destinations: Which one will you love?

seoInfo.metaDescription: From Alaska to the Mediterranean, chart a course for adventure on an incredible cruise that has something for everyone.

tripContent.title: The Wanderer's guide to Saudi Arabia
tripContent.description: "When Laviai, Marsha, and I set out for Saudi Arabia with "The Wanderer" we had no idea how much this journey would change us. We expected stunning landscapes, rich history, and great food—but what we didn’t expect was how deeply we’d connect with the country and its people. From the moment we arrived, we were met with kindness and curiosity, and when we left, it felt as if we were saying goodbye to a home we'd only just discovered. This guide is our way of sharing our firsthand experiences. Whether you're planning your first visit or just curious about what makes Saudi Arabia so special, we hope our perspectives help you see this country with wide eyes, open hearts, and an endless sense of wonder." – Lina

tripContent.title: Orlando: An LGBTQ+ guide for families
tripContent.description: "As a two-mom family who has been traveling to Orlando five to six times a year, we see the city like a second home. We absolutely love the theme parks but Orlando has so much more to offer! We love experiencing Orlando's rich diversity, fantastic food, incredible art and culture, plus a fun soccer game here and there. Join me, Allison Mertzman, as I share some of my family's favorite Orlando attractions with you!" - Allison Mertzman
